problem_summary_simple: Traverse a matrix in a spiral order, from outermost layer inwards.
problem_summary_technical: Use four boundary pointers (left, right, top, bottom) to simulate the spiral traversal, shrinking the boundaries after each layer.
key_insights: The core idea is to simulate the movement of a pointer along the matrix boundaries.
Maintain four variables representing the current boundaries of the unvisited part of the matrix.
After traversing one side (e.g., top row), shrink the corresponding boundary (e.g., increment top) and repeat for other sides.
